Reviews.Title: “A peaceful place in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: Huge1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated opposite the Prado, a ten minute walk from Attocha rail station and close to the wonderful retiro park. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. Our sixth floor back room was small but modern and very quiet. There was a large shower, twin beds and all the usual amenities. Nice complimentary toiletries. we chose not to pay 25 euros for breakfast, opting instead for a good meal nearby for five euros. The hotel has many good restaurants and bars nearby. We particularly liked Santa Ana plaza. Checkout was noon which was helpful and you can pay for additional hours. Bags can be left free of charge at reception too. Overall a lovely hotel in a great location. I would happily return and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: galwaygirl1977
Reviews.Content: Briliant location, very central to restaurants, tapas bars and the park. No more than 10 mins walk to the starting points for the tours we took. There was a starbucks very closeby to use wifi, but we could pick up the hotel wifi in our room (usually restricted to the lobby). Nice rooms - not huge but very clean. Very nice & helpful staff, would definitely stay here next time we go to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Stylish and Good Value with Character”
Reviews.Author: Deirdre Y
Reviews.Content: My husband has stayed here many times on business and we have stayed as a family a couple of times. The rooms can be wildly different, although all stylishly decorated and fitted with nice bathrooms, some of which are shower rooms only. Some of the rooms can be a bit small and oddly shaped so it is worth checking out alternatives if you are not happy, the advantage is that there is quite a variety of rooms and the hotel really does have character, it is not a block of homogenised rooms. We had adjoining rooms on our last stay so our 9 year old daughter could be next door to us, both rooms were on the inside part of the hotel and quite dark but this can be an advantage in the extreme heat of Madrid. There is a small gym on the 8th floor which is worth a visit to look at the views. Some rooms on the higher floors have small balconies but we have not stayed in one so cannot comment on whether it is worth asking for one of these or whether they cost extra. The location is in a nice area directly opposite the Prado, not absolutely central but not much of a walk from the main Plazas and the walk is very nice. The public areas are very nice with a good breakfast served in a pleasant room in the basement. The hotel bar/restaurant serves good, modern tapas and is used by many locals as well as hotel residents. For the price, this is much better than the usual corporate style hotels and we will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pbruns22
Reviews.Content: We visited Madrid in June 2012, and we were there for 3 days on business. Our room had an espresso machine with a full supply of individual servings - we loved it so much we bought one when we returned home. I contacted the hotel 6 months later to get the exact brand of machine (christmas surprise for my husband) and they promptly sent me all of the information. Our room had an amazing view of the Plaza, large windows that opened to the street. In the morning we watched the crowds from the window seat and listened to the street musicians playing accordians below. You could see the glorious Ministry building lit up at night. The location was a walking distance for my husband to work, and the art museums are within a block of the hotel. We only stayed for 3 days, but we are headed back in 3 weeks to stay 7 nights. I can only hope we are so lucky to have another wonderful experience. Is it quiet - maybe not - but who cares? It is the bustle of a city completely alive and amazingly beautiful. We slept with the windows open. The staff was also very nice, even when my hair straightener knocked out the power in the room, we didn't know how to turn on the lights, and they didn't make fun of my failed attempts to speak Spanish. I can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Odiya
Reviews.Content: This NH hotel is ideally located for the tourists, rooms are quite comfortable, breakfast spread is good. Major tourist attractions like Prado museum, Retiro Park etc are close by, so are restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: haveticketwilltravel
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with a wonderful location. It’s right across from the Prado Museum, next to the Westin, and across from the Ritz. When you walk out the front door of the hotel to the right to walk to the Prado, you pass some kiosks in the park and little stores along the street where you can buy souvenirs, if you want. If you walk to the left when you exit the hotel, there is a Starbucks right on the corner. There are also a taxi stand and bus stops just to the left of the hotel, as you exit. The Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum is also to the left and across the street. The hotel is right across from the Neptune fountain; and we paid a little extra to guarantee a nice view of the fountains—it was worth it. Of course, there was some traffic at the circle, but the double paned windows kept out the noise, and there was much less traffic here than on the Gran Via. -- We arrived at the NH Paseo del Prado from the airport by cab (about 40 euros with tip from Terminal 4) and got right in to our room (about noon). We had 2 twin beds (as requested) in a smallish room (as usual in a big city). There was a desk, chair, mini bar/fridge, flat screen TV, lamps on both sides of the bed, small window seat so it was easy to look out at the beautiful view, lots of hangers with regular hooks, and a coffee maker. This was the only room we encountered on this vacation with a coffee maker. It saved us a lot of time and money, since we bought pastries at a bakery on San Jeronimo (south of Calle de Cedaceros) in the afternoon and had breakfast easily and enjoyably in the room. Breakfast was available at the hotel for 19 euros (if you booked it in advance) or 25 euros (without advanced reservations). We did not eat breakfast at the hotel. There were heavy terry cloth bathrobes to wear and slippers to keep. The bathroom had a great shower (no tub), lighted make-up mirror, tissues, hair dryer, and toiletries. -- The Prado Museum is open every evening and is free from 6:00 PM-8:00 PM. We noticed that at 5:45 there was a long line to get in, but if you went later, about 6:30 or 7:15, there was no line. You have to get a ticket from the ticket window before you can enter the museum, even when all you need is a free ticket. It was good just staying for a little while and enjoying a few painting. Also, in the morning, we got to the museum about 10:45 AM and found no line at the ticket window. We needed all day plus two evening short visits to see the museum since we like to see everything. There is a nice cafeteria for lunch in the museum. If you are 65 or over, the reduced price for the Prado is 6 euros (vs 12), so bring passport or other ID if you qualify. -- Walked up San Jeronimo (out the door to the left, then second street to the left) toward Puerta del Sol to find lots of little restaurants off that street. Restaurant employees stand at corners giving out menu offers for the restaurants. We went to La Caserola, Calle Echegaray, 3, twice. A three course meal (appetizer, main course, dessert) including bread and wine/beer was 9 euros. This seemed to be the price at a lot of the restaurants we saw. For appetizer we had gazpacho or paella mixta. For main course we had trout, sole, chicken, or lamb. For dessert we had flan. There were other choices, too. All really good. Quiet. Good service. A simple restaurant. -- Went to Royal Palace one day. It is quite a hike from the hotel, through Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor, but an interesting walk. When we arrived about 10:30, there was quite a line to get in, with everyone standing in the sun. But there was no line if you entered the door to the left of the line and paid the extra 6 euros (for a total of 16 euros) to see the special exhibit of books from the Royal Library in addition to the Royal Palace. So that is what we did. It was soooo worth it. We walked right in to the Royal Palace and also got to see a wonderful exhibit of books, something I’d never thought about viewing, in a beautiful setting. -- The hotel is very near Atoche train station. About 3,10 euros plus tip in a cab. -- The front desk was always helpful with maps and suggestions. There was free wifi in the public areas. -- I would definitely stay in this hotel again and would recommend it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Walker14
Reviews.Content: 2 nights at this hotel and you can get inspired by the museums, monuments, restaurants, and even demonstrations by Spaniards due to the austerity government measurements. The hotel is perfectly located within walking distance to “Plaza Mayor”, “Puerta del Sol” and “Gran Via”. We did get a spacious room but the window was facing a wall 4 feet away (so no view). The hotel restaurant offers breakfast for 25 euros but since there are many choices just outside of the hotel you can walk a couple of minutes and have a great breakfast for less than 5 euros. Just a couple of minutes walk to the right of the hotel is “Cafeteria Prado”, great service and fresh pastries among other things. You must visit Plaza Mayor and taste the delicious “Bocadillo de calamares” Fried squid on a bun. In some of the bars they have it advertized for 5 euros with a beer. If you want to eat the famous “Cocido Madrileno” then go to La Daniela, about 10 minute walk behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: going-around-10
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel with excellent price compared to other hotels in the same category. Location is excellent if you want to go the museums (Prado and Reina Sofia) because it's just across Prado museum and within 10 min of Reina Sofia. It's also within a 15 min walk from Atocha train station. If you're coming from the airport, take the Express yellow bus and get off in Plaza de las Cibeles. Just walk 5 min in Paseo del Prado and you get to the hotel in Plaza Plaza de Cánovas del Castillo (or Neptune Plaza). But despite being close to this places, it's not in the middle of Gran Via with all the shops. Nevertheless, you can easily walk to Gran Via, Puerta Del Sol and Plaza Mayor, I had no problem with that. The room was comfortable but small. Bathorooms are clean, good size, but kind of dark with all that green marble on the walls and floor. Very nice beds. I asked for a quiet room and I got one facing the internal part of the building, so I can't say much about the noise in the street. I didn't have breakfast in the hotel, but I sthink I should have because there was nothing good in the near the hotel... the only complain I have is that they offered free wifi only in the lobby...if you want internet in the room, you have to pay for it. Be aware of the pickpockets in the nearest Starbucks...My friend had his iphone stollen in the very first day of our trip. Two good tips for Madrid: we took the hop-in hop-off bus for 20 Euros. It's ok, but I had seen everything on foot the day before. Nevertheless, you can use the same ticket to get the last bus of the day and see Madrid at night. This was very nice! The other good tip is to have lunch at Mercado San Miguel next to Plaza mayor.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: kelharl
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was in a great location to explore (but still kept blocks away from the bustling crowded center of the shopping and dining area). Right across from the Museums and a 15 minute walk to the Palace and Cathedral. The rooms were clean adn beautiful with a waterfall-like shower and the best breakfast buffet I have ever had in a hotel. Friendly staff that were helpful adn spoke English. The only setback was that free wifi was only available in the lobby adn you had to ask for a new password each time you needed it (only lasting an hour).

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, serviceable hotel near the train station”
Reviews.Author: enjoy_period60
Reviews.Content: We stayed at NH Paseo del Prado for one night before heading to the airport in Madrid. The hotel was affordable and offers free WiFi in the lobby for guests, which was a big perk for Madrid. It's about a 5 minute walk to the RENFE train station, so super convenient for catching the airport bus. The room was pretty generic, as was the pricey breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was good.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff were helpful. room was very nice. Had problem with no hot water on the first day but was sorted out the next day. .

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located, Nice and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: RDS3918
Reviews.Content: I stopped in Madrid for one night at the last minute during the first part of a business trip knowing nothing about Madrid other than seeing stuff on Travel Channel and Anthony Bourdain's show. I didn't do any research which is atypical but hadn't really planned on staying here. I shared a cab with other American tourists (31.5 euro) from the airport and went with them to Westin Palace to see if a room would be available. Only room available was for 300 euro ($430) but they recommended NH Paseo Del Prado which is about 100 years away. For us Americans, the easiest comparison is to a Kimpton hotel in the US, NH is a small botique chain, nicely appointed and stylish. Like many European hotels a tiny elevator (two) and only free WiFi in the lobby, which in this case was OK. I stayed on the 7th floor (704) away from the main street which is quiet but you can still hear sirens if police or fire trucks, but I suppose you would hear those anywhere. Price was 92 euro ($121). The room had two single beds, a desk, nice wooden closets with a safe inside. It's a bigger room because I saw some of the other rooms when the maids were cleaning. The bathroom is good sized with an all marble floor to ceiling tiles and nice fixtures. Free coffee in the morning in the lobby from a Nespresso machine which is nice because I have one at home. The hotel is walking distance (across the traffic circle) from many of the main museums and has access to probably at least 30-40 tapas bars within 400 yards. I think I sampled at least four in the afternoon. Service is excellent, everyone at the desk speaks English well. There is a gym but I didn't check it out. Also has an attached tapas bar but it seems pricier than the more authentic hole in the wall tapas bars in the area. I would definitely stay here again and glad that the Westin folks steered me here!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - upgrade your room it is worth it”
Reviews.Author: IainBrighton
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the NH for 4 nights (work on the Monday /Tuesday and wife joined from Uk on Tuesday night). I upgraded the room on arrival on the Monday and really pleases I spend the extra €29 per night (cost of stay €400 for 4 nights plus €116 for suplement). Room was spacious with a great view over the main square. it was the type of room you did not mind staying in during the day / early eveing before going out for dinner. Did not really use the hotel facilities so unable to comment on breakfast / Tapas restaurant as we tended to buy a late breakfast from Starbucks (after very late dinners) and went into the city every night. Great location so you can walk every where from the hotel. Would strongly recommend this hotel based on upgraded room but not sure what the basic rooms were like.

Reviews.Title: “Would like to write a positive review for this hotel, HOWEVER...”
Reviews.Author: mimionthebeach
Reviews.Content: I have accidentally booked the non refundable room through Agoda.com and am getting very poor service from both the hotel and Agoda when asking to re-instate my booking. I am not asking to be re-imbursed, simply to be able to re-instate the booking I was fully charged for! Seven days later, I am being told "to be patient, and wait for the hotel to respond" while the hotel says I "need to go through Agoda". We are arriving in Madrid in seven days. I will NOT be using Agoda in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Judy C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at NH Hotel Paseo del Prado for two nights after a week in Costa Del Sol. We took the AVE Express train from Malaga to Madrid. The NH Hotel is less than 10 minutes walk from the Atocha Train Station. Also there is a Airport Express Bus from Atocha Station to the Airport for 2 Euro. We walked to all attractions.Our rooms were facing the street. The street below was noisy with people out till 5 in the morning on Saturday. It was fine with the window closed. On Sunday there were fewer people out late. The price we paid at 105 Euro per night included breakfast and all items in the mini fridge (no refill). Considering the location and the quality of the breakfast, it was great value. The breakfast was excellent with many items to choose from. There were variety of fruits, cold cuts, smoked fish, pastries, juice,tea and coffee. The hotel was clean and the staff was helpful. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Cosy Hotel at a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: DXB_AC
Reviews.Content: NH Paseo del Prado's strong point is its location. It is bang opposite the Prado Museum and only 200 mts away from Thyssen Museum. Puerta del Sol is just 1 km away. The hotel rooms are spacious and the bathroom is clean and good. The room service has limited choice but that's expected from a 3 star hotel. There is a VIPS shop nearby to purchase small grocery items. The staff are friendly. My 6 year old son did not have any problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: TaceT
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for a long weekend from 10/02/12 - 13/02/12. We stayed on a room only basis and breakfast in nearby restaurants was cheap, tasty & easy to come by. We also updated to a room with a view upon arrival which was 30 euros extra through a promotion the hotel were running which was well worth it as view was excellent. Despite looking out onto the main road the room was very quiet. The rooms were fairly dated as we prefer more modern furnishings though it was furnished to a decent quality, redeemed somewhat by the good sized shower & bathroom. Hotel staff were incredibly friendly, knowledgeable & polite. Location was fantastic being only a 10 min walk to the Plaza Mayor and 2 mins to the Prado museum (for which I would highly recommend a personal tour guide - please see my Prado Museum review for more details) Only downside is that both myself & my boyfriend encountered numerous electric shocks whilst walking around the hotel, which we think was due to the material the bed sheets were composed off! Overall, the hotel is clean, comfortable, great value for money & would recommend to friends or family staying for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: expatinespana
Reviews.Content: Rooms are rather small but nice. My only complaint is the sheets are not soft.Not bad but not great. Bathrooms are marble with nice amenities. Nespresso coffee maker and coffee in the room. Really great location By the Thyssen and Prado museums and right in front of Calle de los huertos which has a great number of really good taverns and tapas bars.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for the centre”
Reviews.Author: Midge2005
Reviews.Content: A nnice little hotel across from the Prado museum and within easy walk of most of the attractions of central Madrid. Our room was rather small but well laid out but it was all that we needed it to be. Breakfasts were good and the staff were very helpful. The room was rather cold - it being -6C outside and the adjustment on the heating did not seem to work. Other than this I would recommend staying here if you are in Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Business trip to Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Trailingrose
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice now for overnight stay. Very nice hotel in good area. Rooms spacious and very nice. Very nice shower room, no bath. Breakfast very good and room service evening meal had plenty of choice. Very comfortable bed and I had a great nights sleep, which is not always the case on overnighters.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: Visitor2007
Reviews.Content: The main advantage of this hotel is its location, as other reviews have rightly reported here. The room was that small that it was difficult to get around the bed without bumping into furniture. Also note that it appears that standard rooms do not have baths. Although the reception staff was friendly in general, we notice that "security" staff did not always showed similar behaviour towards guests. For example, one night one of them did not even reply to our greeting and followed us all the way from the reception to the elevator in a less than polite manner.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure that you are given an adequate room”
Reviews.Author: Mezzo_giorn0
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on my way back from Costa de la Luz and fortunately only for one night. The hotel was chosen because it has absolutely the best location right in front of Prado, close to all attractions, and the area around is very nice. But that is nearly all positive things I can say about it. I have arrived late and was given a room which faced some tinyest inner courtyard (or better say a hole) with noisy air conditioning units in it. I have asked if they could change the room, but they were fully booked.The room was decently sized, with a good bathroom, but had a very small window and the airconditioning must have been set centrally, because it was impossible to get it colder. Opening a window was not an option, obviously, given what was outside. This is totally not acceptable for the price they charge. The breakfast was average, nothing remarkable, but nothing to complain of. Bottom line - will not stay there again. Standard room is not a value for nomey, and for the price for the room with a view, I would rather go round the corner to a higher level property.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: marchelle2321
Reviews.Content: I was here on a short business trip, found the hotel to be of a very high standard and in a good location. Staff were friendly and helpful, and would recommend here for business or pleasure

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: goddesstraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a couple of nights around New Year's eve 2011-2012. It was a very clean and quiet room. We had stayed at other 5 star hotels in Madrid that same week but this one felt like a real five star and we actually slept through the night without any noise from the hallways or streets though it was on one of the most crowded streets. The staff was also very friendly and price very reasonable. We loved the showers in this hotel. It was also close to all major tourist attraction, train station, and the bus stop to the airport; we easily walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cap249
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Paseo del Prado Hotel during a business trip. The location was wonderful, being so close to Retiro Park and all the wonderful museums. The staff was very helpful and available anytime to help me navigate my way around. A good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- but could be alot better!!”
Reviews.Author: Pheonixzengrl
Reviews.Content: THis is a very well located hotel- it does position, position, position extremely well!! It is right across the road from Museo del Prado, & within walking distance of the market,gardens, restaurants. The room menu is really cool- it is in the form of a groovey newspaper. The room was just ok. The level of cleanliness could have been alot better. The bathroom was dark & not at all practical & made the room seem smaller. The staff had serious attitude problems- a smile would be nice people you are after all in the people business.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: reisman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 5 minutes away from the Banco de espagne metro. Desk staff is very polite and friendly. Our room was facing the street but was soundproof. Breakfast was excellent. Rooms are not very big, but good; bathroom was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: The_shad0w
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night break with 9 friends at the Paseo del Prado. The location is perfect - just across from the museo del prado (well worth a visit, so I've been told) and within walking distance to the botanical gardens, the best bars and finest tapas restaurants in Madrid. Just outside of the hotel is a hop on/hop off stop for the city bus tours, worth doing if you've an hour or two to spare. As for the hotel, the rooms are a good size, bathrooms spot on (huge showers) and in-room safe. There were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room, however. We chose to stay with breakfast included, (additional €15 per person per day) whilst the buffet breakfast was ample, you had to ask the waitress for tea or coffee and also for any additional hot food. The waitress that served us each day (with the pierced face) seemed completely disinterested in serving us, we didn't get offered anything, we had to call her over each time, annoying considering the cost of the breakfast. Despite this I would stay here again, mainly for the location though, but I certainly wouldn't include breakfast (plenty of cafes locally).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly businesslike hotel”
Reviews.Author: azs123
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for Madrid visitors (including easy nearby parking if frinds come to see you). The Reception is very helpful (after Air France lost my bags). Lots of good restaurants of every level within walking distance. And the Thyssen is next door. Get a good map of Madrid before you go! (Note that the Michelin w/e Guide is good, but wrong on most of the visitor details of the Monasterios de las Descalzas).

Reviews.Title: “ultra convenient”
Reviews.Author: Edgie
Reviews.Content: We spent a nice weekend in Madrid, intending to spend all day in the prado. This hotel couldn't be better located, just across the road from the gallery, and a short walk from the airport bus stop (bargain at 2 euros) Nice room, nice lobby with free wifi, the breakfast is ridiculously expensive so just go to 'Faborit' round the corner as we did. All in all, great to a cultural trip to Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Great for Madrid museum lovers”
Reviews.Author: PaulafromBoston
Reviews.Content: This hotel is steps away from both the Prado and the Thyssen, and a brief walk to the Reina Sofia. Although the rooms are a bit small, it is a great bargain, especially compared to its neighbors, the Palace and the Ritz. Despite the fact our room was on the second floor directly on the Paseo, it was quiet. Only complaint is that free wifi only available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, expensive wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: LatinFan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in NH paseo del Prado for 2 nights.I got a room in the second floor facing the interior part of the building. The room was very dark and the lighting was terrible; but the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was big& clean with a nice rain shower head, plenty of towels, and the regular toiletries (no conditioner though) . The ceilings in the room were really high (15-20 feet), that was cool!.The staff in the front desk were nice and helpful, the staff in the breakfast room less so. The breakfast was nice,( I do not know the price since my hotel was paid for). There is a Starbucks right next door. Internet was 18 Euros for 2 days!! but it was fast.As everyone else said, nice location

Reviews.Title: “Reception service excellent”
Reviews.Author: Lacducs
Reviews.Content: Contrary to other reviews, I cannot speak highly enough of customer service received (all by email) from front desk at NH paseo del prado. Without going into details, they (especially Maria) have been extremely helpful and accomodating- going that extra mile to confirm and reconfirm when they could have just told me to sort it out with the web site where i actually made the reservation. When I am up and about, I cannot wait to spend a night there. Very impressed by the attention received.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel of Trip”
Reviews.Author: ntjvy
Reviews.Content: Favorite hotel of a five city trip. The location is fantastic, easy walking to many things in a nice neighborhood. Loved the room, the food downstairs was amazing, staff helpful. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you expect from a business class hotel in Europe”
Reviews.Author: siddharthdhamija
Reviews.Content: Nothing fantastic but end of the day, no complaints against this hotel at all. My expectation levels were low but still the hotel flared well on all parameters. Location is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but....”
Reviews.Author: tropicalia
Reviews.Content: Paseo del Prado Many reviews have praised the hotel’s perfect location (hey, you are across the Ritz and next to the Palace for a third of the price). We stayed for a week and had a standard double room (609). It was tiny, but very nicely decorated. It faced the wall of the building next door, (most rooms face an inner courtyard or THE wall) which made it very dark, but we thought it would make it quiet. Wrong! It was the internal noises from within the hotel that started around 5:00am which woke us up constantly. We told the front desk and they said it was an AC problem that was fixed. We didn’t hear anything the next night, but then it started again. We must say they offered to move us, but by then we had unpacked and the thought of wasting two hours moving was not appealing, so we declined. There is not a single drawer for storage, no stationary. The dark green marble bathroom, although lovely makes everything even darker with poor lighting. It has a moldy look and smell. We kept leaving our shower door open and our window to air out the room. Again, we told the maid and a special effort at getting rid of the odor worked for a day. Breakfast is 25 Euros per person, a bit too steep for Madrid. Go next door to VIP’s, a great coffee shop with slow service, but you can buy a newspaper and linger. Reception was not knowledgeable about a couple of questions asked and we speak fluent Spanish. Would I stay at Paseo del Prado again? Not sure.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault this hotel - location, ambience, staff and value for money just perfect for us.”
Reviews.Author: cyberquokka
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a 4 or more star, last minute, and found this establishment right where we wanted to be - in the heart of the museum quarter. We had a room on the second floor that faced the busy plaza but it was quiet and very comfortable. The breakfast was very diverse, fresh and plentiful. The staff were all friendly, well trained and helpful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great restaurant, will def stay there again”
Reviews.Author: galwaygirl1977
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location, lovely hotel, very central, very helpful & knowledgeable desk staff, delicious food in the restaurant downstairs to the right - starbucks, a shop for water, wine, snacks, etc and a nice Americanised restaurant to the left for when you're too exhausted to go further, taxi rank & bus stop outside the door... stayed a Friday & Sunday night so had two different rooms, both really good, the ones to the front are bigger & brighter & surprisingly quiet at night (bad sleeper so any noise would be noticed), the showers in both rooms were about the size of my kitchen with a fab rainfall shower head. Any review I read said that you couldn't get wifi in your room but they gave us loads of the pages with the codes that meant we could access it for as long as we liked using our own laptops & phones from our bed. They also kindly let us log on and use their office printer for our boarding cards, very impressed with every aspect, will stay there if we go back and totally recommend staying there in the meantime! Super value in any major city, regardless of location, I booked directly through their own website for some good non-refundable deals and paid about €65 for the Friday night, €90 for the room with the view on a Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: Joe_petr
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the paseo del prado and I have to say this was my best stay in europe so far. To see this hotel ranked at 144 there must be some world class hotels in madrid!!! We paid 140 euros plus tax per night for 6 nights the staff was great the location is perfect, the beds are average at best but its nice I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a place!”
Reviews.Author: globezipper
Reviews.Content: I was here in August. July and August are in my opinion probably the best months of the year to visit Madrid. Most of the Madrilenos are on holiday, and the city is not empty, but much calmer than usual. You will probably even find a parking space on the street (although beware: everything is metered nowadays). And to top it off: you´ll get the best hotel deals for Madrid during this time! I got a very special deal that included a late check-out at 17:00 and the whole mini-bar included in the same price. That´s right: death by mini bar ;-) The late check-out is great. The free mini bar may sound nicer than it is in practise though, because if you think you´ll make use of that, it means that you won´t be going out too much and launch yourself into Madrid´s night life, which would be a serious gap. I got a special offer: 37 EUR extra per night for a superior room which included a jacuzzi and a bigger corner room. Excellent!!! As with all NH hotels, breakfast is wonderful. At this hotel it was even better than in most other ones I experienced. No free Wifi except at the lobby (30 minutes at reduced speeds with a voucher that you get at the reception). Stay at this hotel if you can, I seriously doubt you´d regret it. Although I guess you´ll pay much more outside of July and August...

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and overall good stay”
Reviews.Author: Arina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at NH Paseo Del Prado in July 2011. Had a room with a fountain view. We arrived at 2 a.m. due to a plane delay and were greeted by a friendly staff member. The hotel is rather small, but cozy. All staff members were very friendly and very helpful with their recommendation regarding museums, transportation, etc. Hotel provided all supplies everyday: toothbrushes, shaving supplies, lotion, shampoo, conditioner, sponge. The lobby had fresh flowers everyday: roses, lilies, etc Hotel was clean and has a gym with a nice view. Location is very good: it’s across road from Prado museum. Since the museum is free 6-8 p.m., it was very convenient to visit the museum. Also, there is a restaurant in the hotel and a small café on the corner. There are also 2 metro(subway) stations close by so you could go anywhere in Madrid. The breakfast in the hotel was rather expensive and we didn’t use it. Otherwise loved the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Visiting for friends wedding - excellent”
Reviews.Author: MahoneyclanBrighton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel because it was just across the road from the Ritz where our friends were getting married. What a great location - it was really close to the shopping area, the museums, Retiro Park where I had my husband rowing us around the lake, royal palace, opera house, etc, etc and all this in easy walking distance. I am sure we walked for miles in one direction or another from this hotel, but always ended up soemwhere interesting which is great. We stayed on a b&b basic and food was fab. Loads of choice and really fresh. With the staff refilling trays which were getting empty. All of the staff were friendly and accommodating. We had a fabulous 5 days there and would definitely go again. Our room was on the 1st floor just on the side looking out to the roundabout. However with great double glazing there was noise at all. With really good air con the room always felt comfortable even though the weather was really hot.

Reviews.Title: “Not where we intended to stay, but a great experience.”
Reviews.Author: MEDRoswell
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at our reserved hotel on July 5th after arriving from Atlanta (Raddison Blu) we were told the hotel was having some problems and we were offered a complimentary stay down the block at the NH by the Raddison with there regrets. I had no experience with NH Hotels before, but we were in not much of a position to argue and were anxious to get a quick shower and start exploring Madrid so we made our way to the NH. We were greeted very warmly and were given a room overlooking the Triton Fountain. The room was very nice with a large jacuzzi tub. Our only trouble was figuring out you had to place your room key in a slot by the door in order to activate all the lights in the room, I am guessing this is to conserve electricity. The room safe was locked closed, but maintenance had it open within 5 minutes of a call. The location for exploring the Centro district cannot be beat. we were a slow 3 minute walk to the entrance of the Prado, and only about a 15 minute walk from Plaza Mayor. If you don't care for walking there is a Taxi stand and major bus stops just steps out the front door. The hotel bar had tasty looking Tapas, although we chose to go explore in the surrounding neighborhoods. Breakfast was included for us, and the NH had an impressive and tasty spread of breads, meats, cheeses and fruit. Some of the best pastries we had in our 2 weeks stay in Europe were at the NH buffet. Internet is free for an hour in the lobby, just get the code from reception, which was all we needed to check email over breakfast. Thanks to the NH for making our first night on the Continent a very pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful architecture - great location”
Reviews.Author: gmiker
Reviews.Content: All of the architecture of Madrid is beautiful and clean. Art Museums are in very close proximity. The Museo de Prado and Naval Museo are great choices. The rooms were nice with wonderful bath/shower. The beds were a little hard but I slept well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Rap0140
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, near all major sites in Madrid. Although the rooms are smallish, they are well maintained, clean and have excellent bathrooms. The staff at the front desk couldn't be more accommodating and friendly. Breakfast was quite good, although the staff was a bit officious. The lobby is quiet and well appointed. Wifi is available free in the lobby. Easy walking to everything.,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Good Staff, Excellent Breakfast incl., Note Caveat about Free wifi”
Reviews.Author: miketha
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nites end of March. Front desk people great (unlike some other reviewers reported.) Booked thru AARP and pd. $179/day. We don't usually stay at 4 or 5 star hotels. Usually 3 star. Booked this because of location. We walked everywhere! Also chose this because of "free" wifi in the lobby. Most upscale hotels make you pay thru the nose for wifi in both US and overseas. Well, it turned out the wifi worked - even in our lst floor (American would call it 2nd floor) room. Problem was you had to enter a user code and ID - but only lasted an hour from first signon before you had to obtain a new ID/PW. Since there were 2 of us, we could get 2 at a time. We used the wifi for wife's ipad and my T-Mobile BBerry. With T-Mobile BB phones and most Androids - with a wifi connection you can make free calls just as though you were in the U.S. (Calling U.S. numbers free., Calling overseas 2 cents/min by using outside service to route your calls - seamless w. a BB or Android app.) Now that we know Madrid, we probably could have found a 3 star hotel in the same general location for less $. Note - room would be considered on the small side by some people.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but rooms could be nicer”
Reviews.Author: Joachim73
Reviews.Content: The hotel as such is nice. Good location, good breakfast and facilities. The rooms could be nicer in terms of quality and size.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality and service”
Reviews.Author: darkcherryred
Reviews.Content: I just stayed 2 nights for business reasons, and I didn´t have much time to o sightseeing but the little I did and every time I had to go out I did it without problems because it´s in the centre and there´s everything near. Rooms were correct, I didn´t lack anything

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk people have No Shame!”
Reviews.Author: ai780903
Reviews.Content: It was a rainy day my husband and I had lunch at Estado Puro, the restaurant in the hotel. We spent only a few hours in Madrid and we had to go to the airport. We've known a cab driver and we wanted to give him a call after lunch so that he can drive us to the airport. The restaurant was packed so we decided to ask the front desk of the hotel to call the cab, rather than bothering people at the restaurant. When my husband asked the front desk for the favor, they said, "There is a public phone in front of the hotel." It was pouring but my husband went outside and tried the public phone twice. The line did not go through. When he came back and asked the front desk to call the cab, they refused to make this one phone call, just because we were not staying at the hotel. They said, "sorry but it's not our problem." What kind of service is this? At the end, my husband went back to the restaurant, and our waiter picked up his own cell phone to call the cab. The restaurant was superb, but the front desk people at this hotel (3 of them!) have no shame! We would never stay in this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location--poor service at front desk”
Reviews.Author: tomber
Reviews.Content: We booked four nights at the hotel at around 115 Euros per night (website now shows 95 Euros). We booked hotel because it has a wonderful location, across Prado, close to Thyssen Museum, etc. This is a four star hotel. We arrived at the hotel. It has a revolving door (not convenient for large luggage) and two side doors for baggage which were locked. No doorman (apparently exists only for five star hotels.) The people at the desk saw our struggle with the luggage and -- ignored it. Eventually a tourist from the hotel opened the door for us. Still no help; my wife fell with the luggage. Still no help. Eventually got to reception desk which was manned by two people. I complained, about no help with the luggage. Answer: "We do not provide that service". We took a look at the room, which had a narrow window looking at some storage site. Not pretty. Then I asked for the (reception) manager and gave her my complaints. She was very nice, and upgraded us to another room (normally 20 euros extra). This room looks at Paseo del Prado, nice window and the room is nicely furnished. No queen size bed, only two twins. Small frig in the room. TV shows CNN, BBC news, CNBC and Sky news. Buffet breakfast 19.5 Euros in advance, 25 otherwise. We did not indulge. Free wifi in the lobby. Thermostat in the room is very slow to respond. Try to call reception desk a couple of times. No answer. Bottom line so far: The (upgraded) room is nice, but the hotel seems to provide minimal service, not 4* quality. (Walking around towns I saw 5* hotels, and they had been the only ones with doormen.)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful located !”
Reviews.Author: Max341968
Reviews.Content: I've traveled a few times to Madrid during the past months and was kind of disappointed due to the location of the hotels which were located a bit outside of the city. Thus I decided to book the Paseo del Prado this time, and the location is wonderful if you also like to visit Madrid during your visit there. Located in the city center it is a perfect location for this.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: rain125
Reviews.Content: We just spent a night here and had an inside room. It wasn't huge but it was very well appointed and tastefully furnished to a high standard. The location is perfect for sightseeing and there are plenty of small local restaurants and bars in the area.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good service, decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: rqtect
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a spectacular location one short block from the Thyssen-Bornemisza and across the boulevard from the Prado. The buffet breakfast was also top quality with everything to satisfy a hungry teenage son, vegetarian daughter (including soy milk) and a carnivore husband. The rooms were on the small side and a bit dingy, especially as they faced interior air shafts as their only source of light, but the bathrooms were well appointed and clean. The staff were extremely helpful, including providing a very early check in so we could rest after our early morning arrival from long international flights. And the internet was actually reliable and relatively fast (unlike much of Spain). There is also a Starbucks and a VIPS (convenience store) next door.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anil-from-Delhi
Reviews.Content: Not the very comfortable stay, but quite central location. very near to all the major attractions and the Atocha station. Small rooms, costly stay compared to similar priced stay in madrid. Fantastic Buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent find!”
Reviews.Author: steveh59
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good value, and conveniently located. The staff was helpful and accomodating...We arrived mid morning after an overnight flight from Chicago. They allowed us in the room early to get some much needed rest. We stayed three nights. The room was clean, modern and comfortable...maybe a little on the cozy side, but not to cozy. The entire hotel was up to date and modern. The price was good, and the location was excellent....across the street from the Museo del Prado, close to the Atocha train station, and walking distance to the metro. We thought the breakfast was a bit pricey at $25 euros per person, so opted for breakfast at Starbucks--two doors away. There were many restaurants within easy walking distance. I didn't care for the fact that in room internet use was a chargeable item (I don't understand why any hotel charges for this), but free access was available in the lobby. I'd stay again, and would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “comfy, clean hotel in a great location - we loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: tobyo99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our last night in Spain and we were so glad that we did. The lobby is very plush, as are the carpets on the stairways and the hallways. It was all so elegant and colorful. We had a double room with an added bed for our 10 year old. The room itself was a little small. The bathroom was very nice with a cool shower! We chose to have tapas at the sidewalk cafe attached to the hotel and had a fabulous evening. The food and service were impeccable. I would absolutely, hands down, stay here if I'm ever in Madrid again. The only, very small, complaint I would add is that there is only 30 mins. free wifi, after that, you pay a fee for whatever service you choose. oh yes, you can't beat the location especially if you're going to visit the big three art museums. all are within walking distance, Prado basically across the street, Thyssen a block away and the Reina Sofia is about 7-10 mins. walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great staff, great breakfast = GREAT”
Reviews.Author: djb3280
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise, I spent ages trying to find an affordable central hotel in Madrid and this was a great result. The value was great (we stayed 3 nights and had a very good discount, so if payed full asking price I would probably have a different opinion). The staff were all friendly and helpful. The shower was amazing and the room was very spacious. What was really nice was the breakfast, it was gourmet and was a complete surprise when you consider what the standard hotel continental breakfast is. This hotel really made our stay memorable and Madrid a fantastic place as everything was in easy walking distance even with a pram and baby. Only downside was no free internet in the rooms and the passage smelled a little of smoke, I think some rooms are smoking, but could be because everyone smokes in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Museum Enthus Must, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tringuyen82
Reviews.Content: pros - location near big three museums (prado, reina, thysses) modern, modern room huge bath i received a good view (of corner street) cons - far from san miguel area and puerta sol bit of a walk from metro stop, banco espana (not rec with >1 bag, use taxi 25E w tip) difficult to find good eats near area

Reviews.Title: “Paseo Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Westhaven_Wanderer
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a group of 18 and right from my first email hotel were helpfull. Rooms excellent size and well fitted, bathrooms superb. Location can't be faulted, walking distance to all city centre attractions. Breakfast is a little expensive if it is not included in your room rate. Starbucks and VIPS next door so plenty of other options for breakfast. Hotel bar is popular with locals, we spotted a Real Madrid player eating there with his family so I think that is a good endorsement.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet luxury”
Reviews.Author: HoppyEu
Reviews.Content: Had been booked into the NH Samvy but got 'bumped' into this nearby partner hotel - and am so glad! The NH Paseo del Prado is well situated on this fascinating boulevard and very handy for the museum district. I had a double room at the back which was *exceedlingly* quiet (no traffic noise whatsoever); it was a good size, had a modern, tasteful decor, comfy bed, thick pile carpets, and a very good shower room. There was no tobacco odour in the hotel - a great plus in Spain. Breakfast buffet was stylish and way more than I could cope with.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: tecouag
Reviews.Content: Ok, the hotel has a very nice location infront of the Museo del Prado. The rooms have a good size and they offer 15 minutes of free internet in the lobby. They have a breakfast menu that is good enough. Bad new: The rooms are little dark, if this is not a problem for you, this is a very good option in the heart of Madrid. You can go walking to Cibeles, Puerta de Alcala, Puerta del Sol, La Gran Via, Museums The personal is very friendly and helpfull In this same area there are 2 luxury hotels: Westin and Ritz, so the same convenient location but with a budget price

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: V.V.Hartford
Reviews.Content: Excellent location right next to Prado and Thyssen museums and very short walk to Retiro Park.. Staff went out of their way to be helpful from arrival right through check-out. Rooms looked like they were just renovated. Try to get one with a view to the street.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic position”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaKangaroo
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Madrid at the last minute so had to find a hotel fairly quickly. Didn't have time to read reviews so was a bit nervous. Turned out to be a good decision as it was only 10 minute walk from station. Prado museum was virtually opposite and easy walk to most attractions. Rooms were quite spacious but ours and our friends were "internal" which I was a little upset about. The weekend rate was very reasonable and included breakfast but when we decided to stay another 2 nights the rate increased dramatically and did not include breakfast. we were accidentally charged for breakfast 1 morning and it was over 50 euro for the 2 of us. They provided 15 minutes of free internet and the mini bar was fee for the first night. Nice touches Biggest problem we had was the air conditioning which they seemed unable to adjust and we cooked for the first 2 nights. The hotel was very quite and reception very helpful. Would reccomend

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: girlinspain1971
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with my mum, have stayed in the Hotel Villa Real which is nearby before which is why I chose this hotel because I knew the location was brilliant. The room was lovely, location perfect, staff absolutely excellent - couldn't compain about anything really. The breakfast was gorgeous and at the weekend you can have breakfast until 12 o'clock which was lovely. Will definately stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Valinhas
Reviews.Content: I was in Madrid for the FITUR tourism fair (27Jan-01Feb) and I've staid in NH Paseo del Prado for the first 3 nights. Excellent location (right next to Prado & Thyssen Museum as well as a Starbucks Coffe and VIP's food chain), 5 minutes from Banco de España metro station (red line). My room was quite nice, even though my window had a awfull view to the air conditioning system and with almost no natural light. But in Madrid... you'll spend always few time in your room. Nice-confy bed with good pillows, cable tv, in-room-safe and a very nice wc, with a open/stand shower all in green marble. I loved it! Really excellent for those typical Madrid hang-overs! :p There was also one thing i didn't like about the room. Every time you entered the room and put the key-card on the light switch, the air conditioning turned on in a real TROPICAL temperature. And when you just thought that thing would turn off... it didn't. So you'd enter the room ALWAYS heated! Breakfast pretty well presented and with a lot of diversity. Staff always nice and helpfull. WiFi perhaps a little high... 17€ for 24h, or 10€ for 1h. Classification: 4/5

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful all in all”
Reviews.Author: ESCARZAGA
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great location to discover Madrid, don't hesitate, this is your choice. We had a nice room overlooking Neptune Square.Ask for a high floor, the view is great. Bathroom had everything you need but could have been bigger. Staff was very helpful but the best is the hotel location.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location !!!”
Reviews.Author: irelandjoanne
Reviews.Content: fantastic location . great breakfast. will definately be back!! hotel great value for money for location. joanne ireland

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: SirGoofy
Reviews.Content: Location is important because my wife and I would like to see as much as possible in three days. The hotel is nice and clean. Even the smoking room does not smell of cigarettes. 10 minutes walk and we arrive at Puerta Del Sol. Overall the hotel is good. We paid around 104 Euro per night, the most expensive on our three city trips. We don't spend enough time at the hotel to justify paying so much. The breakfast is good. No wifi though, which is a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Canary With An Attitude / Avoid”
Reviews.Author: WorldWiseGuy
Reviews.Content: Typically small rooms. Indifferent staff. Very small bedroom. Exceptionally large and nice bathroom (although the teak on the shower floor was black with rot in spots). This what happened to me. As any veteran traveler knows, the first thing that one does when assigned a room is set down your bags and take a look around to see if it is acceptable. The room had a large framed mirror leaning on the wall as a design accent. The mirror had a hairline crack or two near the bottom. I called Isabelle at the front desk to let her know that there was a crack in the mirror, but the room would be fine and would she please note that the mirror was cracked. She agreed. I later asked for a clock. She told me that they were in the minibar. It took her awhile to understand that I wanted a clock, not a coke. The hotel does not provide clocks in the room! But they do have cokes. So, when I check out , there it is - a 300 euro charge for the mirror (as handed to me by Isabelle). I told her that we spoke about the mirror and she said that she told the manager and he had her charge me. The manager, nor anyone else at the hotel had brought up the mirror over my stay. I asked to speak with a manager and there was no manager on duty. At 11:30 AM ! THE GOOD: Location. The bathrooms. THE BAD: No clocks. The Front Desk Staff. The doorman does not open the door or greet you. Housekeeping did not make our room up until after 4:00 one day. The Managements Philosophy That Guests Should Pay For What Was Probably Wear and Tear, Another Quests Damage, Housekeeping, or Just a Poorly Mounted Mirror - I Don't Know. I just wonder if they would have charged me if I had not accepted the room because the mirror had hairline fractures? I guess it is between me and my c card company now.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Zorro98
Reviews.Content: Great location. The interior rooms on the courtyard are very quiet. Loved the bathroom! The breakfast was great and the restaurant had wonderful views of the street and the square. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: Globe_Trotter_0880
Reviews.Content: Booked a weekend break to celebrate our anniversary and got a damn good deal through lastminute.com. Got to the hotel, and was very impressed with the rooms and mind you I am extremely fussy about where I stay. We got an excellent view of the fountain and a Jacuzzi in the bedroom which I must admit was a great touch to the room. However my only complaint is the disinterested staff at front desk, it took a bit of begging to pay to be upgraded to a bigger room as the initial room we were shown was the size of a box and rather claustrophobic. Moreover it was situated in what I can only describe as the service area. Anyhow, the hotel was in excellent location, rooms were more than adequate especially for the price we paid (even with the additional upgrade cost). Only advice to the hotel is possibly to get your staff to serve with a smile - even if they're faking it. At one point, staff were debating as to who was going to flag a cab for us. Despite this I thoroughly recommend this hotel for a city break, just don't expect too much in a way of service from non-smiling staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a city break”
Reviews.Author: ArdvarkNI
Reviews.Content: Booked to stay here on the advice of TripAdvisor reviews and was not disappointed. We stayed for four nights in early November. Location is excellent, in the middle of the three must see galleries and near Retirio Park. Very close to a great selection of Tapas bars which are in the streets immediately behind the hotel (try Los Gatos if you want a recommendation). If you prefer cocktails try the Ritz Hotel across the street or the Palace Hotel next door. Five to ten minutes walk takes you to the centre of the old city. Metro is 3 minutes away. In other words the location gets no better. Rooms are clean, quiet, well serviced and tastefully decorated in a quirky contempary style. Some of the rooms open on to internal courtyards and are very quiet. Bathrooms are well furnished and vary depending on the room. Reception is efficient and helpful. Restaurant/Bistro on ground floor is pleasant and has a reasonable menu. Breakfast is served downstairs and has a good range of choice in the buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Two main museums across the street”
Reviews.Author: Voyagian
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. The Prado and Thyssen museums are within a 5 minutes walk. The sightseeing bus Madrid Vision is across the street. It's also a bus stop for many buses. It takes a 10 minute walk to the metro station. Just 200 meters behind the hotel, you'll find a lot of tapas bars. A Starbuck cafe is located 30 meters from the hotel door. The hotel and my room is clean. There's wireless internet connection (about 35-40 EUR a week), a safe in the room, and a small fitness center with 2 treadmills. My room quiet as its window is toward the backyard. The staff is helpful. I have no problem recommending it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: SallyFB
Reviews.Content: We booked through Lastminute for 3 nights 19-22 Oct. for £500 for 2 people incl. flights from London City. That is very good value as the Gran Canarias is 4* and in a very good location. A lot of Americans stay here which is a good recommendation. We had a standard double room ( Room 101 ) at the front of the hotel but there were trees directly in front of the window which obscured the view . The room was a good size and the marble bathroom felt very luxurious. I was very disappointed that there were no tea and coffee making facilities. In future I will check first and I will always take a mini kettle with me if there is none in the room. Even though I am enthusiastic in trying all foods and drinks, theres nothing like a decent cup of tea. My husband came back from Starbucks with a spicy milky drink they call Chi tea or something! The room was quite dark and a little noisy as the Terrace Bar music speakers were right under the window. The bar shut around 12.30 so it wasn't a problem when we slept at night, and only disturbed our siesta! The windows are triple glazed so very little traffic noise. We had clean sheets and towels every day and the room was spotless.Bathrobes and slippers are provided too. I am pleased we didnt stay up near Puerta del Sol where it is busier and noisier. The Terrace Bar is a bit pricey but you are paying hotel prices. A small Fanta Limon was 3.50 euros!! We didnt use the mini bar or room service for this reason. It is a little uphill to the main attractions eg Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol ( best bars, tapas and restaurants round the back streets here), Plaza Santa Ana ( very lively Friday and Saturday evenings til late) There seemed to be many American and Spanish tourists and a few northern Europeans, so no loud hen and stag parties. Overall, a bit more " upmarket ". Prado and Reina Sofia are free on Sundays. We travelled from the airport to the hotel by Metro but, although it was only 2 euros, you have to change 3 times, it was busy, it took 45 minutes and there are a few stairs to carry your case up and down! A taxi will cost around 30 euros. Check out the buses, I dont know if the bus is any less of a hassle than the Metro if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Top location and everything we wanted”
Reviews.Author: AndytBeverley
Reviews.Content: Great location, very close to Prada and Tyssen art collections Only 5 minutes walk to the historic area including Santa Ana square and 10 minutes to Plazza Mayor Great value for money - was quality at reasonable price Can't imagine a better hotel in Madrid under £100 per room/night

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MxUK01
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in Madrid - right opposite the Ritz and round the corner from the Westin where we witnessed a fabulous society wedding - complete with men in uniform ! ( The Westin looks great but you may need a big budget to stay there). If you need a taxi - the doorman ( in a top hat ) finds one like magic. It's right over the road from a bus stop for the sight seeing bus - a definite must. There are loads of bars and eat places around -,we went to one where people were queueing to get in and so cheap, forgotten the name - explore it's fun ! - and it's within really short walking distance of the old town, eat tapas standing in the street and you must try Plaza Santa Anna ( very cool hotel bar there - fab.) The room was really good, very good shower, lights in the wardrobe, squooshy bathrobes - very big mirrors. Lighting was a bit odd as it was an inside room but the upside to no view is total silence. All of my luggage came home with a gorgeous smell from the bathroom scents. Breakfast buffet was more than adequate. Big plus was that the reception staff were very helpful with tracking down lost luggage - Heathrow nightmares - my colleagues last on the way out - mine on the way back. All sorted eventually and Madrid is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “I agree, this hotel was fab”
Reviews.Author: lolasanfrancisco
Reviews.Content: After arriving from the other Spain cities in 2 and 3 star hotels, this hotel was just what I needed: modern, huge rooms, off the hook 24hr room service that I ordered 2x in one day. I never left my room, due to a tummy ach, but that was the place to do it for sure. This is not however, a 5 star, it’s a top of the line 4 star, so for those who want over the top, it’s not here, however, it’s great for those of us who want a reasonable splurge. Go for it, book it, it’s all good! PS. It’s too far to walk from the train station, a cab is a whopping 7 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked the Gran Canarias”
Reviews.Author: BedfordshireReviewer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 07 for a few days. We really liked this hotel. The staff were friendly and very helpful. We had a lovely room and a really comfortable bed. Our room overlooked the square with the fountains - we thought it would be noisy but in the end we did not notice and the view was always interesting. It was very central for the Prado and Thyssen (across the road) and indeed for everywhere. Taxis were cheap and frequent and there was also a bus stop - 5 minutes to Atocha Station. We went on a day trip to Toledo and to El Escorial both by train from Atocha. We enjoyed this restaurant - La Finca de Susana at Calle Arlabana and a popular little cafe called La Plateria Bar Museo which was a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Both of these eating places were very popular with local people. Madrid is a delightful and interesting city full of history and culture but also very relaxed and straightforward for the tourist. We arrived by train from Barcelona and left by train to go to Seville - a great way to get to know Spain. We would stay at the Gran Canarias again - it was comfortable,easy and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel.. So convenient”
Reviews.Author: chelle1986
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. On arrival the reception staff were very nice and also the bellboy who helped with the luggage on arrival. we were put into a room at the back of the hotel which was perfect because there was no road noise to be experienced. the rooms were very nice. A big double bed with very warm blankets if needed and very good pillows. Bathroom is huge with a very big and owerful shower. They provide you with bath robes and slippers also. There is a big flat screen television but not a lot of english channels. Hotel bar is lovely with seat outside on the main street and a good breakfast also provided in a big breakfast room. The location of the hotel could not have been better. It was just a short walk from Puerto del Sol and the Gran Via. If you are Irish there are a good selection of irish bars around there on the Espoz Y Mina street that do very good food. It was also within easy access to the Principe Pio shopping centre which you get by metro. All in all a top class hotel and as a travel agent I will definately be selling this hotel to clients.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy, Clean & Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: spitzgan
Reviews.Content: Wow, did we get lucky! With no hotel reservations upon landing, we went to the tourism/info desk in the Madrid airport. We had narrowed to two choices from a guide book and other research. The first was unavailable. Luckily, we ended up at the Gran Hotel Canarias! For just 105 Euros (low season), we had a lovely room that overlooked the Neptune Fountain. In addition, we were spitting distance from the three glorious art galleries in Madrid (The Prado, the Thyssen, and the Reina Sophia). We visited each of them and hiked all over town from this convenient location. The room had a comfortable bed, beautiful linens, a fancy bathroom, and even an in-room refrigerator! There was a simple gym on the top level, a very generous and varied breakfast buffet, and virtually no street noise through the thick windows. There is a bar/restaurant adjacent to the lobby as well as helpful concierge/bellhops who guarded our luggage after our check-out. We would DEFINITELY recommend your checking out this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “For Europe--a swanky hotel”
Reviews.Author: Madeline38
Reviews.Content: I had been living in Madrid for five weeks when my husband came over to join me and we stayed at the Gran Canarias. It had just opened and on the first night, the AC broke (a crisis for an American but not much of an issue for a Spaniard). Aside from that, the hotel is gorgeous. It's clean with beautiful bathrooms. Some of the rooms can be tiny but again, this is typical in Europe. The bed had fabulous sheets and was so comfortable and the staff was extremely helpful. It's also located near major plazas, museums and metro stops. You can walk to so many places from here. It was $$$, but I'd rather pay the money and be comfortable. And the best part? The doorman. He's one friendly guy.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is overrated”
Reviews.Author: ExpatTravelerUK
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a great trip to Spain. We (family of 4) spent 3 days and nights in Madrid in early August (temperatures were very hot) and one of them was at the Gran Canarias, although we originally booked the entire stay at the hotel. Let me start with the positives first before I am accused of bashing the hotel. You can't beat the location. It is very close to the sites and in a safe area surrounded by good restaurants. The rooms are good size and the bath rooms are fairly large. In addition, we had a good rate which included breakfast which was pretty good. Now the negatives. We are a family of 4, with 2 teenagers, so we booked two rooms. - Bathroom Shower: The shower has some type of wood meshing on the floor which looks good, however, there is a musty smell coming from it. It almost smells like a gymnasium shower. - Uncomfortably Hot Hotel: We checked in with no problems and were given 2 adjacent rooms. Both rooms were extremely hot, about 26C, but we knew that to be the case since the AC is not activated until the room key is inserted into the switch slot. Well, we turned the AC on full blast and waited about an hour and the temperature did not budge. We called reception and they sent the maintenance man to make sure we were operating the temp control correctly. He was a nice enough man but he did not speak English. Fortunately, my wife is fluent in Spanish. He told us that we were operating the AC temp control correctly but we had to turn off the lights and close the bathroom door to allow the room to cool down. We were suspect of the advice, but we did that in both rooms, and 2 hours later the temp had increase to about 27C. I went down to reception and complained. They switched my wife and I to another room. My kids did not want to switch rooms so they just sweated it out. It turns out that our new room was just as hot (27C) after 2 hours of full AC. At this point, we were wondering whether or not the hotel had a larger problem since 3 rooms had AC problems and the hallways and lobby were very warm. We approached reception again and they told us that the maintenance man had left and we would just have to deal with it. Reception also made it clear that no other guests had complained and made it seem like we were the problem. So we stayed in the room that night and it was an awful night with room temperatures exceeding 26C. It wasn't until 2 or 3A, when outside temperatures cooled a bit, that we opened the window and we were finally able to get some sleep because room temp dropped to 22C. The next morning, we did a little test and closed the window to see what would happen to the room temperature, and yes, it did increase by 1.5C. So, here we go with reception, again. The maintenance guy showed up around 10A and worked on the problem while we were at the Prado. When we came back reception had told us that they could not fix the problem and that we had to change rooms again. We told then that we would change rooms, but the rooms would be at a new hotel. They said they were sorry and proceeded to check us out the hotel. I thought that they would somehow try to incentivize us to stay, but they didn't. Anyhow, to end this rambling story, we went around the corner to a nicer hotel, but paid an additional 5 euros/nt (and breakfast not included). It was well worth it since the rooms had functioning AC. Maybe this hotel had an overall problem with the AC, or maybe having 3 rooms that had AC problems, was purely coincidental. Either way, it was our experience and I would not recommend this hotel, especially in the summer. If you can get a comparable rate at the hotel around the corner, I would definitely consider it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: tulipano64
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a long week end in Madrid and stayed in this hotel. The room was very nicely decorated and appointed (a bit small but we booked via internet and got a very favourable rate). Very nice breakfast with and good quality of fresh fruit. The staff at the Front Office were all very nice, particularly we would like to mention Claudia...she is definitively a plus for the hotel. The location is probably the best you can have, overlooking Neptune Square (in front of the Ritz), next to the museum El Prado, 2 minutes from Thyssen and 10 minutes walking distance from Sofia Reina museum, Porta del Sol and Plaza Mayor. If we would go back to Madrid we would dfinitively stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mickeym0use
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the first leg of our Spain honeymoon. We thought it was a very elegant hotel with an amazing bathroom. It had all of the amenities one could want. The breakfast buffet, which was included, was very good. The bellhop was very funny. The staff was professional. The hotel is in a good location: across from the Prado Musuem, near the Retiro Park and metro. It was within walking distance of Puerto Del Sol and Plaza Mayor ( outside cafes). We enjoyed our stay and would recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Whinbrook
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 4 nights at this hotel. The location is unbeatable for the big three museums but for shopping and restaurants and old Madrid, while not out on a limb, is a little remote and being located between two metro stations is a little inconvenient too. The staff are neither helpful nor polite unfortunately, except the security guard and and doorman who were more helpful and friendly than the whole staff combined. At check in the male receptionist completely ignored us in and conducted a conversation on the phone without once acknowledging our presence. Consequently, he allocated us a room that was out of commission. Fortunately a chamber maid was close by when we got to the room and phoned reception to point out their error. We went back down and the same receptionist, still on the phone, allocated us another room without an apology or even speaking to us. The new room was at the rear of the hotel overlooking a bleak lightwell so was quite dingy. However it was very well furnished, comfortable with some nice decorative touches and the B&O tv and telephones were impressive. The bathroom was superb too, fabulous shower and had good towels and toiletries (including the hotel's signature cologne). Breakfast was comprehensive and very good except trying to get a cup of coffee was difficult, especially over the weekend were wait staff were conspicuous by their absence. The public areas of the hotel were quirky and had a fun element in their design. Unfortunately the bar staff were as unpleasant as the front desk staff, refusing to serve us in a certain area of the hotel's lounge, the reason we never found out. As previous reviwers have said, the proximity to a branch of the VIPS restaurant/convenience store chain is of great advantage, we ate there once and it was good value and quality and useful for drinks to take back to the room. We had afternoon tea in the Ritz which was fun and much better value than in London and would recommend the restaurants La Gamella, an easy stroll from the hotel and Teatriz (a Phillipe Starke designed restaurant in a converted theatre) which is a longer walk away off Serrano (the top notch shopping street in Madrid). I think there are better hotels in this category in the city but if the Prado, the Thyssen-Bornemisza and the Reina Sophia are your reasons for visiting Madrid, you could do worse.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Hotel Canarias - The Perfect Place to Stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: sally3662
Reviews.Content: I just spent 5 days at the Gran Hotel Canarias and my family and I would return there in a heartbeat! We had an interior triple room which opened on to a light well, sadly no view, but also no noise. The bathroom was huge, modern and incredibly well stocked. There was more closet space in our room than I have in my bedroom! The location is unbeatable, across the street from the Prado, one block from the Thyssen and a short walk from the Reina Sofia. We were able to walk everywhere in Madrid and never felt unsafe. Plenty of tapas bars and restaurants in the area. Other than a suite at the Ritz I can't think of a better place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Across the street from the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: JackBJack
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at Plaza Neptuno, across the street from the Ritz and next door to the Westin. Absolutely stunning, tree lined location. Staff was superb, helpful and attentive. The standard room was beautiful. Our room had a view of the plaza. Great insulation and double windows so no noise problems. Great price, great location in Madrid, across from the Prado and just blocks from Atocha Train station. Was a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Murrays
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights in this hotel in early May and we loved it. Based on what we had read on this website we booked a superior room directly with the hotel. We wanted a spacious external room with views and that's just what we got - a beautifully furnished spacious room (gorgeous bathroom with jacuzzi bath and rain shower) which, due to the fact that it was on a high floor (Room 617), had fabulous views - definitely worth the extra cost. My husband used the fitness room on the top floor - small but ewith xcellent equipment and fabulous views from the floor to ceiling windows. The location could not be beaten - the Prado to the right with the Parque del Retiro just beyond that, the Thyssen to the left and the Reina Sofia just a short stroll away. We could walk everywhere including to the Plaza Mayor, the old town and the Royal Palace and this really is the way to see Madrid. The streets around the hotel had numerous tapas bars and restaurants. La Plateria (turn right when you come out of the hotel and walk for a couple of hundred yards until you come to Plaza Plateria Martinez) was a favourite with a great location, very tasty food and great value (this was recommended in Maribels guide). We will definitely be back to Madrid and highly recommend this hotel.
