PS I am posting details of 'A perfect day in Madrid' on the Madrid Forum for when you've done all the top sights - Prado, Thyssen, Retiro etc. but would like a nice relaxing day with a little sightseeing, a little shopping and plenty of rest stops!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near the Prado and Thyssen museums”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaElizabeth
Reviews.Content: We really loved staying here. It's very pretty and amazingly quiet, considering you are on a busy plaza. The breakfast was delicious, the best breakfast buffet we had in Spain, including two beautiful paradors. Our room only had one chair for the two of us, but I really can't complain about such a beautiful and convenient hotel. It's non-smoking, too, a real plus in Spain. It's right across the street from the Prado and Thyssen-Bournesizma museums. Since there are about 2000 paintings (of incredibly high quality) to view in the two museums (which both offer tickets for the full day), it's a real bonus to be able to come back to your pretty room and rest between museum visits. We also found a really good tapas bar just 2 blocks away. We never felt unsafe in this area. It's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TPXB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (both 40 and American) stayed at this hotel from April 6-14 and loved it. We went to Madrid for the sole purpose of visiting the three major museums and we could see two of them (Thyssen-Bornemisza and Prado) from our window. We actually watched the line for both museums from our room to judge when they were shorter. The rooms have great showers and the bathrooms are green marble (lots of green marble). We had two beds and they were great. The rooms have Bang & Olufsen TVs and phones. The area around the hotel is loaded with places to eat dinner and go "tapas hopping". We could have spent our entire 8 days within a four-block radius of the hotel. It is also an easy walk to the train station and we took day trips to Toledo and El Escorial from the train station. The hotel bar was nice, but there are so many places nearby that you don’t really need it. There is also a VIPs next door, which is similar to a diner/convenience store, where you can get newspapers, water and other a sundry items Also if it is important next door to the VIPS is a Starbucks. Which was very convenient a couple of mornings when we were headed out on a day trips. This is a great hotel, in an unbeatable location. With that said here a few quirks (particularly for American travelers): -To work the lights you must put your key card in a slot by the door. This is more common in European hotels than in American hotels and this little bit of knowledge would have saved my wife and I an half-hour of our vacation and an embarrassing phone call to the front desk. -They don’t have irons for the guests. They do have a laundry service and it will cost you 9 Euros to have a shirt pressed. Needless to say, I went around wrinkled in Madrid. -The rooms are like casinos – no clocks. This wasn’t a big deal but we had to leave wake-up calls any time we needed to be up. They were very pleasant and in English and Spanish. A travel alarm clock would have made things easier (think someone else posted this and I forgot).

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: PAMomanddaughter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Gran Canarias from last Friday to this Thursday, 3-30 to 4-5-07. Ride from airport about 30 minutes and 25 euros there, 20 on the way back. Great location, near everything. Hotel was very clean, room was perfect size, shower was really good. Service excellent. Hotel seems to have been updated recently. Small but excellent exercise facility with new equipment. Great view up there also. View from our room was Paseo del Prado, fountain of Neptune, Museo Thyssen Bournamisza, Westin Palace, church on calle de Cervantes. Breakfast not included with our really low rate, but got it twice and we were stuffed full. Fresh towels and sheets and turndown service daily. Internet isn't cheap, but so what. We walked everywhere in Madrid from there, didn't ever need to use the metro. Hotel arranged trip to Toledo on tour bus, but frankly if you have a little adventure in you, you could definitely take the train there and figure it out, as long as you don't mind a long uphill walk. There are many restaurants, cafes, bars, including tapas, little mercados in the neighborhood, especially on calle de las Huertas, Gran Via, but really all over. Most take credit cards. Museums are fantastic, great time. We eat vegetarian which was tough but found enough places with veggie food and that was the best food we had anywhere. You can't go wrong with this hotel, in our opinion. Would definitely go back there. Try hoteltravel.com or booking.com for the best rates for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! But...”
Reviews.Author: x2fr
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Gran Hotel Canarias for two nights for a quick weekend visit to Madrid. The best thing about the hotel is its' great location, across the street from the Prado Museum. And it's walking distance from the Retiro park and Gran Via. Although the hotel's neighborhood is an active, lively part of the city, on a busy street, I could not hear the street noise from my room! Btw, there's lots of good restaurants and bars that are walking distance from the hotel. In case you want to mingle with the rich and famous...the Ritz Hotel and the Westin Palace Hotel are practically next to the Canarias. Subway station is a bit of a walk from the hotel, lots of taxis around. Taxi to/from Madrid Barajas airport would be around 25-30 Euros. Train to/from airport to hotel will require a couple of transfers, not recommended if you have heavy luggage. My room was not very spacious, would've been a bit cramped for two people but was clean and has nice amenities, Bang&Olufsen TV and phone, for instance. Ample, well-lit, closet space with a safe. Thick robes, towels, and the bed linen is luxurious, however, I was given a twin bed and it was quite narrow so, ask for a king/queen bed. My only real complaint is... I don't know if it's just my room but it had a bit of a musty smell and I think it's from the slow draining shower stall or the damp wooden platform in the shower stall. Housekeeping tried to cover up the smell with a deodorizer but didn't completely get rid of it. Other than that, the common areas of the hotel are clean; elevators are quick although small. The staff was helpful and efficient but not particularly warm or friendly but not rude either; they're just doing their job. Overall, I would recommend this hotel if you want to be in a great location when visiting Madrid. But only do so if your rate would be less than the Westin next door. I wouldn't pay more than $180 for the room I got in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In Heart Of City But Quiet Room!”
Reviews.Author: Maggiesoup
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel overlooking the fountain beside the Prado & only 10 mins walk from centre of Madrid. We booked directly by telephone, seemed a little cheaper, for 3 nights and had orignally asked for a kingsize bed in double room which guy said was no problem. On arrival, we were disappointed to be shown to a small dingy room on the 2nd floor with no view and 2 SINGLE BEDS! Returning directly to Reception the girl said she could not guarantee a ks bed at the rate we were quoted (100 euros a night), we explained that we had been told this would be ok but because it had been booked by telephone we had no proof. However it was in a good location and we couldn't be bothered trudging around other hotels so just asked to be ungraded and paid an extra 30 euros a night. Was well worth it as we were taken to a huge room on 6th floor with a stunning view and amazingly quiet considering our location.. The room had electrically adjusted curtains, huge sunken bath with aero bubbles and shower wth large shower head in marble coated bathroom with & excellent selection of toiletries, dressing gown etc. Nice Bang and Oulsen TV in room, complimentary safe etc. Lovely decor and all in good condition. Maid service superb, room immaculate when we returned to change for dinner then bed turned down and chocs on pillow on our return around midnight. Would definitely recommend this hotel but if you agree a room and rate then get something in writing. They don't appear to have a direct website address (nothing on their business card) but we should have faxed and got confirmation that way. We will in future! Enjoy Madrid, its a fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Henk_Oldenhof
Reviews.Content: The Gran Hotel Canarias is an excellent hotel at a perfect location near the Thyssen Bornemisa and Prado Museum. While the Reina Sofia Museum is 'just around the corner'. Furthermore it is about 10 minutes walk from the wonderful Parco Retiro. If necessary there is a busstop right in front of the hotel and there are 2 Metro stations within 1 km. The Brasserie/Restaurant that belongs to the hotel has a small but very inviting menu. The staff is very helpfull and correct; I had bought tickets for a Real Madrid game on the internet from a local organisation but hadn't received the tickets at the time they promised. People from the hotel went to great lengths to contact that organisation and make sure the tickets were delivered. The room was very nice with good furniture and a fine bed, the bathroom was fine also but the lighting indeed insufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: dorisg
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 double rooms for 5 nights at USD150.00 per night, breakfast included for the New Years. The hotel is relatively new, cozy, nice & comfortable lobby. Has an excellent location, next to the Palace, the Ritz & the Villa Real hotels. Walking distance to the Museum's Trio, the Old Madrid with La Puerta de Sol & the Plaza Mayor, the Retiro Park, La Gran Via among other major attractions and a hop on/ off sightseeing bus stop right across the street. l asked for specific rooms & was pleased with my choice. One was an exterior room facing the Neptune fountain, good size very well appointed. The other was an inside room even bigger than my exterior room. The housekeeping department was not great as rooms were not as cleaned as I will have wanted & 2 days without soap. But after a couple of days it improved a bit. No bathtub, but big, green marble walk in shower. Didn't like the wood floor on the shower, felt a bit uncomfortable on the feet. Nice toiletries, big towels, slippers & robes were provided. The included buffet breakfast was very good, fresh with plentiful selections, served until 10:30 AM weekdays & 11:00AM weekends. My only complaint was the front desk / concierge personnel. They were nice & polite but not very knowleagable. Usually there was only one person on duty, had to wait a lot for service & directions & most of the time didn't know the answer to your inquiries. Very often the doormen, bell boy or security guard were on duty at the front desk & had no clue on anything.Many times went to the nearby hotels to ask for information but definitely will recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Relatively mod hotel, close to museums”
Reviews.Author: Jet-Setter-SF
Reviews.Content: I switched to this hotel after a few nights in an inferior Madrid hotel. I was looking for something with a more modern sensibility, closer to shops and museums, and better internet access. I succeeded on two fronts. The hotel had a nice ambience -- not the generic uber-mod feel of a W, but still a new, fresh feel. My room had the typical two single beds pushed together, but a nice view out the windor and new furnishings. The Prado and other sights were easy walking distance. The only downside was the internet connection. The hotel advertised "high speed internet in all rooms", but in fact, they were switching providers and only half the rooms were internet capable. Worse, the provider was having difficulties that weekend and the entire net was down. (There's a 24 hour Kinko's like place with internet 10 minutes away by foot, but even that was sub-par, speedwise.) I didn't experience room service, but the hotel restaurant (an ersatz brasserie) had an odd, eclectic menu, in my opinion. I wouldn't go back. The bar was not inviting for a single business traveler to settle in. Fortunately there were lots of bars, restaurants, and a Starbucks nearby. Hotel staff were friendly and all had a good command of the English language. Like my previous hotel in Madrid, there was no way to lock the door from the inside, so housekeeping staff sometimes barged in on me without knocking. I now consider this SOP (standardc Operating Procedure) for Madrid hotels. Again, definitely use the "do not disturb" sign. The bathroom was a bit over designed. It had all the standard amenties, including bidet, of course. The shower waterworks was a bit contrived, but functional. Downside: the lighting in the bathroom made it hard to see yourself in the mirror above the sink. Shaving was a challenge. Maybe other rooms were different. All in all, a decent hotel. Nice design in the rooms, but would have been better if the internet had been working.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely renovated building”
Reviews.Author: JayneLondon
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in central Madrid. I only had one night there on business but chose it based on other TripAdvisor reviews. Lovely room (although for business purposes, lighting could be better) - would be wonderful for romantic weekend. My room was on the first floor - no view from the window but wonderful bathroom with "rain" shower and Bang & Olufsen plasma TV and music system. The building is beautiful, but you need to explore a bit to appreciate it. There is a restaurant downstairs (didn't eat an evening meal there) where breakfast is served - good buffet EUR15 per person.

Reviews.Title: “great-if you get a room!!!!”
Reviews.Author: whiteroseLancashire
Reviews.Content: Even after booking direct with the hotel via e-mail and submitting credit card details as requested to guarantee the rooms, we arrived to find there were no rooms available. We were told we had been transferred to another hotel (miles out of town)because of a flood on the whole of the 7th & 8th floors. We discovered later this was total fabrication. We were eventually given two rooms (one of them on the 7th floor)but only after refusing the alternative hotel, a series of lengthy arguments and a 2 hour sit-in in the lobby. The other room was 102- very noisy(above the restaurant) and had a strange smell in the bathroom. A spanish lady I spoke to at the hotel explained that overbooking is a regular thing . No further apology was given-and the manager wasn't available to speak to. My sympathy goes to the poor reception staff who have to lie to customers. On a positive, its a nice hotel in a brilliant location.

Reviews.Title: “Very small double room!”
Reviews.Author: chufa
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay in this hotel but went there to have a look of their rooms and facilities. The standard double room is very small. There is no bathtub in the bathroom (only shower). It is a small but luxurious hotel in a convenient location for tourists. Booking via Internet is recommanded because of the better room rate offered. Service of the hotel is no known since we didn't stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: MPV1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located. The service was an A+++ The rooms are much smaller than what they look on Internet pictures, but they are very nice. Excellent bathrooms, big showers, cozy bathrobes. Wireless Internet is only accessible from the second and third floor. (for an additional fee) The have parking (for an additional fee). Breakfast is served until 11 A.M., enough choices to please any palate. They have few bedrooms with a view. It was very difficult for me to get a room with a queen bed, Iinternet access and a view. Definitely, request everything ahead. You are paying for it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb quality, style and position”
Reviews.Author: marieanddon
Reviews.Content: Superb location, 10 mins walk from train station. Clean high quality hotel within easy walking distance to sites and good food locations. Directly oposite Prada and on bus route to hop on hop off bus. The bathroom was fabulous with excellent shower, robes and slippers. Will definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: jelmer
Reviews.Content: In october we stayed 4 nights in this cosy and excellent hotel. The room we were given initially was a little on the dark side and without much of a view. When I asked the desk clerk for a room with a view on the plaza, we got it immediately and without any problem. This room (402) was much lighter than the interior room and it was not noisy at all. Amazing if you saw how busy the plaza was.. Having seen the two types of rooms, my impression is that the rooms are all of the same high standard. Most of the other reviewers have already described the rooms, so I refer you to them. Suffice it to add that we did have internet acces... The room was very clean and of a very high standard. We could have done with a little bit more lighting, but that is probably a question of taste. The breakfast (included in our deal with hotelclub) was excellent. There is an enormous variety and if you order somtething special, they will bring it to you as well. You realize even more the excellency of the location of this hotel when it is pouring with rain, as it did for most of our stay! Having the Thyssen Bornemisza opposite of the hotel and the Prado not much further down the road is an incredible bonus when Madrid is almost flooding... (which probably happens rarely, but we have experienced it first hand)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: adanacsim
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel very much. It is located in a safe and fashionable part of Madrid (next to the Westin Palace and across the street from the Ritz), perfect for museum-goers. The rooms were variable in size but in general large by European standards, clean, modern and well-appointed. Because we asked for a quiet room, we were shown to one facing an interior shaft. It was very large and certainly quiet. However, we opted for a room (616) overlooking the plaza. it was also large but much brighter. Despite a warning by the desk clerk that it would be noisy, we found it to be well insulated from traffic noise by the double-paned windows. The hotel was very clean, the beds were comfortable and the bathroom was more than adequate (we had a walk-in shower rather than a bath, but that served out purposes). Only two quibbles: (1) there is no concierge and although the desk clerks were very pleasant, they didn't always have information at hand that tourists often seek; and (2) although the rooms were advertised to have Internet access, it was only available in the lounge and bar areas (where the wi-fi system worked very well and where there were plenty of outlets for the computers). All in all, an excellent value and an impressive hotel. We recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: quito
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated in a safe,classy part of the city across from the Prado right at Neptune Circle. It is walking distance to the Atocha station and the metro. The hotel is beautifully finished with the finest of carpets and fabrics, marble etc The buffet breakfast included in our excellent rate through hotelclub.net was fantastic with the highest of quality ingredients and a large selection. Our room was not huge but well organised, faced inside with no view but lots of light. It was very quiet which is what we wanted. A card with a magnetic strip is needed to keep the power on in the room (eg. key card). There is no clock in the room but a wakeup call can be arranged. There is a safe in the room. We loved this hotel and would highly recommend it.
